intro: Croton matudae, commonly known as the Matudae croton, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with characteristic latex-producing structures. The plant is characterized by its striking, colorful foliage, often featuring shades of red, orange, and yellow. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters in its natural habitat. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
